meanings.definition: Approach and address (someone) boldly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The stranger accosts me on the street, demanding money.
meanings.sent2: She accosts her friend with a big smile every morning.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy accosts the mailman with wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm accosts the coastline with fierce winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The persistent salesman accosts every passerby with his pitch.

meanings.sent1: The hero accosts the villain in a dramatic showdown.
meanings.sent2: He accosts his fears head-on and never backs down.
meanings.sent3: The toddler accosts the broccoli on his plate with a determined glare.
meanings.sent4: The student accosts the difficult math problem with determination and focus.
meanings.sent5: The detective accosts the suspect with incriminating evidence.
